article_node.title: He once earned 6 figures at Microsoft. Now he's unemployed, burning through savings, and at risk of losing his home.
article_node.summary: Mody Khan, a former Microsoft cloud solution architect, was laid off in December 2024 after a series of performance concerns and is now facing financial hardship with limited savings and a looming mortgage default. His job search has been hampered by age bias, perceived lack of startup experience, and possible regional discrimination, despite completing an AI certification. The article highlights broader tech layoffs—Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and others have cut thousands of jobs amid a hiring slowdown—illustrating the sector’s tightening labor market and the challenges mid-career tech professionals face in securing new roles.
